comment.author: 29056926@N02
comment._content: "Piracy through a Barbarian Lens" is a paper which discusses this incident, this photo, and their treatment by historians and anthropologists. I don't see it published anywhere, but the author could be contacted.

comment.author: 64015205@N00
comment._content: I have written to the author.

comment.author: 14463561@N06
comment._content: www.flickr.com/photos/eatsee111/2315076279/ This photograph shows the execution of the Namoa pirates outside the Kowloon Walled City on 17 April 1891 = 這幀照片正是在一八九一年四月十七日「南澳號」海盜在九龍城寨外的海灘上被滿清政府處決後攝得 Police Report of 1890 made by W.M. Deane, Captain Superintendent of Police, to the Governor, which recorded the Namoa Piracy in details. According to the Report, among the suspects arrested, five were Hakkas who lived in Shaukeiwan, Hong Kong.

comment._content: There is a good article here www.executedtoday.com/2009/05/11/1891-namoa-pirates-hong-... The namoa pirates were people pirated the British steamship Namoa as it took Chinese nationals back to their hometowns in China from the stop off in Hong Kong.
